body: The agency that oversees New York City's waterfront yesterday made public its first comprehensive plan to regulate the construction and operation of recreational and commercial marinas and boatyards. The regulations combine existing rules from other city agencies with new regulations. They specify for the first time how marinas can be built, what
title: CITY PRESENTS NEW RULES FOR MARINAS

body: A new format in the Grand National Teams brought 24 strong entries into action here Wednesday. Eight of them survived into tonight. One of these, the Hudson Valley, N.Y., team, headed by Allan Stauber, of Poughkeepsie, led Michigan by 27 international match points, with 36 deals remaining and has an excellent chance of reaching the semifianals. The
title: Bridge: Hudson Valley Survives Play In Grand National Teams

body: Four years ago Sidney Steinberg and Anthony Clemenza were renovating vacant loft buildings as apartments on lower Broadway in Manhattan. They did 32 units in Nos. 710, 722 and 620 Broadway, selling finished, full-floor apartments. ''But that business is dead,'' Mr. Steinberg said. ''You can't get vacant buildings and the city wants you to pay $5 to
title: ABOUT REAL ESTATE; CONDOMINIUMS RISE IN FLATLANDS AREA

body: A 14-year-old Brooklyn girl was in critical condition at Coney Island Hospital yesterday after a van she was riding in plunged into the Mill Basin in the Flatlands section Monday night, killing her four teen-age companions. The girl, Diedra Silverman of 2527 East 63d Street, was submerged in 38-degree water for more than 30 minutes after the van,
title: GIRL IS REVIVED AFTER VAN SINKS IN FRIGID WATERS
